intro: Amomum subulatum, commonly known as the needleleaf cardamom, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and aromatic, spicy fruits. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity. The plant's rhizomes and fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticulture and culinary applications.
